timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Taken at request of Adam de Vidrange, chambellan de Son Altesse; witnesses 1-16

timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Witnesses 18-19 testified; substitut for PG asks for interrogation and confrontations

timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; confessed to being witch, seduced by Mre Cercelle 3 years earlier, attending sabbat, using black powder to kill animals and people

timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Substitut asks for death sentence; confessions confirmed

timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
timeline.details: Formal sentence from court at Amance

accomplices_named.name: Jean Bourca le vieux
accomplices_named.context: Identified at sabbat; she recognized him by his trousers

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: Et que quant elle avoit affaire de quelques choses, elle s'en alloit aux champs avec ladite feuille, disant avec les mains jointes, mon dieu de paradis et benoiste vierge marie enseigne moy toutes les herbes que je cherche. Ce faict elle trouvoit incontinent tout ce que luy estoit necessaire
notable_quotes.english: And when she needed something, she would go to the fields with the said sheet, saying with hands joined, my god of paradise and blessed virgin mary teach me all the herbs that I seek. Having done this she found immediately all that was necessary for her
notable_quotes.context: Accused describing her herbal healing practice to witness 1

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: adjoustant qu'elle scavoit beaucoup de bonne recepte, mais que sy elle s'en servoit l'on diroit incontinent qu'elle estoit sorciere
notable_quotes.english: adding that she knew many good recipes, but that if she used them one would say immediately that she was a witch
notable_quotes.context: Accused expressing awareness that her healing knowledge made her vulnerable to witchcraft accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle avoit adjourné devant les grant Juges, tous les gros d'Amance, qu'il n'y restoit que le sieur de Vidrange plaindant, mais en fin qu'il y estoit aussy adjourné avec les aultres, qu'ils seroient tous en enfers, et eulx bien estonnez de la veoir en paradis, et qu'ilz luy faisoient de place
notable_quotes.english: that she had summoned before the great Judges, all the important people of Amance, that only the sieur de Vidrange plaintiff remained, but finally that he was also summoned with the others, that they would all be in hell, and be very astonished to see her in paradise, and that they were making room for her
notable_quotes.context: Accused's defiant remarks about divine judgment reversing earthly verdicts

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: que ladite damoiselle femme audit sieur plaindant l'avoit esté querir pour veoir ladite vache et la traisne comme Judas fit nre seigneur que ladite damoiselle marchant devant comme Judas et qu'elle la suivoit comme nre seigneur
notable_quotes.english: that the said lady wife of the said plaintiff had summoned her to see the said cow and betrays her like Judas did our lord, that the said lady walking before like Judas and that she followed like our lord
notable_quotes.context: Accused comparing herself to Christ and her accusers to Judas

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: que le sieur plaindant estoit pire qu'un Caiphas et qu'il falloit bien que le diable luy heut dict qu'elle estoit sorciere
notable_quotes.english: that the sieur plaintiff was worse than a Caiaphas and that surely the devil must have told him that she was a witch
notable_quotes.context: Accused's bitter remarks while in custody, comparing plaintiff to biblical figures who condemned Christ

notable_quotes.speaker: Margueritte femme Jean Estienne
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle estoit sorciere elle n'en scavoit que ce qu'il luy en avoit aprins
notable_quotes.english: that if she was a witch she knew nothing of it except what he had taught her
notable_quotes.context: Accused's defiant response implying accusers create witches through their accusations

notable_quotes.speaker: Jeanne femme Claude Ferquel (witness 6)
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y avoit loing temps qu'elle avoit envie de se jetter a elle ne fut esté l'empeschement de ses gens par ce qu'on luy avoit dict qu'elle la soubconnoit sorciere et luy avoit donné ladite maladie
notable_quotes.english: that for a long time she had wanted to throw herself at her were it not for the restraint of her people because she had been told that she suspected her of being a witch and had given her the said illness
notable_quotes.context: Accused confronting witness about suspecting her of witchcraft

economic_context.details: Accused worked as healer/herbalist; had debts for bread (witness 20); multiple disputes over livestock damage to gardens; caught stealing grain 12 years earlier by witness 16; accused was known for healing animals and humans using herbs; daughter worked in fields (meadows) for plaintiff previous year and had not been paid

harms_catalog.harm_description: Cow fell ill after eating accused's cabbages, died 2-3 days after being treated by accused; still gave good milk 3 hours after death
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Cow eating accused's cabbages; accused said 'it would not be like previous year'
harms_catalog.method_alleged: treatment with oil of camomile soup

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell ill within 3 or 4 days of cabbage incident

harms_catalog.victim_name: cow belonging to Didier Martin's wife
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wife had refused accused milk 14 years earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: Abscess on throat which had to be lanced
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Girl said she thanked God she had recovered her health; accused told her to be quiet and she was not cured yet

harms_catalog.victim_name: baby of Jeanne femme Demenge Balatte
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused wanted to be present at birth but was not invited
harms_catalog.method_alleged: Witness thought she saw accused at window preventing birth

harms_catalog.harm_description: Plank twisted and she fell into hole up to her neck while carrying wood into loft, was there all twisted for some time
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused remarked they had a lot of wood
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: as she was carrying it into loft

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse belonging to Noble Jean Pierre Dattel
harms_catalog.harm_description: Went lame; blacksmith found infected foot
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He called her witch and accused her of causing it

harms_catalog.victim_name: grain at mill (Jean de Loizey's father)
harms_catalog.harm_description: Machinery went wrong and grain was spilled
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Father had quarrel with her about who should go first at mill; manhandled her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: immediately when he put grain in

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He would not enter her service

harms_catalog.harm_description: Killed one of her own hens
Killed a sheep which was ill

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Claude, wife of her cousin at Pulenoy, had refused her some grain 2 years before

third_parties.name: Mre Cercelle (devil)
third_parties.context: Accused confessed under torture to being seduced by this devil 3 years earlier; gave her money that proved to be oak leaves; had intercourse with her; gave her black powder; asked her to make hail; visited her in prison

third_parties.name: wife of Adam de Vidrange (plaintiff)
third_parties.context: Sent for accused to visit sick cows; accused compared her to Judas betraying Christ

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with 21 witnesses. Interrogation and confrontations noted as missing in document. Rich testimony about accused's healing practices, her defiant religious rhetoric comparing herself to Christ, and economic disputes. Confession obtained under torture (thumbscrews and rack). Multiple instances of harm following quarrels over property, livestock damage, and refusals of aid. Accused was known healer who successfully cured animals using herbs, which made her vulnerable to accusations. Notable for accused's articulate defense and bitter commentary on accusers as worse than biblical figures who condemned Christ. Trial shows tension between healing practice and witchcraft accusation.
